review_title: A great charity to work for
job_title: Marketing and fundraising officer in Birmingham, England
pros:
Clean Sheet is a really great charity to work for. The team is friendly and close-knit, and I receive ample support from my manager. There's a real emphasis on making sure the staff's wellbeing is looked after which is really valuable. We all work from home but have regular touch points online to maintain connections.
The work Clean Sheet do is amazing and I'm thankful to be a part of it.
cons: A lot of work and a small team! But, this does mean you get loads of experience.

review_title: Excellent Employer, Supportive Managers, A Chance to Make a Difference
job_title: Employment Team Adviser in Coventry, England
pros:
- Supportive managers who listen and take on feedback. Always understanding of personal circumstances. 
- Fantastic team members who are ready and willing to help one another.
- Flexible home working 
- Regular opportunities to catch up with team members over Zoom/ phone (this is necessary when you work remotely)
- An opportunity to work with people who need support and make a real difference in their lives.
- An employer who adapts and implements feedback quickly.
- Your workload is managed well to make sure that you are not overloaded with work.
cons:
- There are a lot of people who need support and a number of admin aspects to the role, so you have to be able to manage your time well.
- Reliant on good WIFI access.
- Some of the people we help face desperate situations, which can make the job challenging (but it also makes it more rewarding when we are able to help).

job_title: Employment Team Adviser in Southampton, England
pros:
A great, caring team and management even though we're all working remotely.
We are able to help people with convictions all over the country.
The link and support from Langley House Trust are really positive.
Personally it ticks a lot of my boxes: using IT to help people find work, working in a team but also independently, standing with people who are having a rough time, being able to contribute to the charity's development, the challenge of finding new ways to do things, saving the country money by helping people with convictions to find meaningful work and training.....
The introductory training prepared me well for the role.
Team coffee and chat times.
We get some great feedback about the effect we are having from our Members (clients).
cons: Recording every detail of every conversation challenges my typing accuracy somewhat, but it has to be done.
